Normalized Helmert contrasts for parsimonious random effects models

Source: R/misc.R
contr.nhelmert.Rd

  • R Library Contrast Coding Systems for categorical variables

Usage

contr.nhelmert(n, ...)

Arguments

n

a vector of levels for a factor or the number of levels.

Examples

zf <- factor(c("A","B","B","C"))
contrasts(zf) <- contr.nhelmert(3)
contrasts(zf)
#>         [,1]       [,2]
#> A -0.7071068 -0.4082483
#> B  0.4082483 -0.7071068
#> C  0.0000000  0.8164966
library(nlme)
#> 
#> Attaching package: ‘nlme’
#> The following object is masked from ‘package:spida2’:
#> 
#>     getData
set.seed(123)
n_within <- 10
n_schools <- 20
n_treatments <- 3
dd <- expand.grid(id = 1:n_within, schoolid = 1:n_schools)
dd <- within(
   dd,
   {
      method <- factor(sample(LETTERS[1:n_treatments], nrow(dd), TRUE))
      methodn <- C(method, contr.nhelmert)
      methodmat <- contrasts(methodn)[methodn,]
      grade <- 10 + seq_len(n_treatments)[method] + rnorm(n_schools)[schoolid] + rnorm(nrow(dd))
   })
fitfull <- lme(grade ~ method, dd, random = ~ 1 + method | schoolid,
 control = list(returnObject = T))     
#> Warning: nlminb problem, convergence error code = 1
#>   message = iteration limit reached without convergence (10)
#> Error in solve.default(pdMatrix(a, factor = TRUE)): system is computationally singular: reciprocal condition number = 1.45397e-26
summary(fitfull)
#> Error in eval(expr, envir, enclos): object 'fitfull' not found
getG(fitfull) %>% svd(nu=0,nv=0)
#> Error in eval(expr, envir, enclos): object 'fitfull' not found
fitfulln <- lme(grade ~ method, dd, random = ~ 1 + methodn | schoolid,
 control = list(returnObject = T))     
#> Warning: nlminb problem, convergence error code = 1
#>   message = iteration limit reached without convergence (10)
summary(fitfulln)
#> Linear mixed-effects model fit by REML
#>   Data: dd 
#>        AIC      BIC    logLik
#>   642.2126 675.0446 -311.1063
#> 
#> Random effects:
#>  Formula: ~1 + methodn | schoolid
#>  Structure: General positive-definite, Log-Cholesky parametrization
#>             StdDev       Corr         
#> (Intercept) 1.276249e+00 (Intr) mthdn1
#> methodn1    6.547993e-02 0.939        
#> methodn2    3.487524e-15 0.000  0.000 
#> Residual    9.907437e-01              
#>

getG(fitfulln)
#> Random effects variance covariance matrix
#>             (Intercept)    methodn1    methodn2
#> (Intercept)  1.6288e+00  7.8433e-02 -2.0372e-28
#> methodn1     7.8433e-02  4.2876e-03 -5.2348e-30
#> methodn2    -2.0372e-28 -5.2348e-30  1.2163e-29
#>   Standard Deviations: 1.2762 0.06548 3.4875e-15 
getG(fitfulln) %>% svd(nu=0,nv=0)
#> $d
#> [1] 1.632589e+00 5.096079e-04 1.216282e-29
#> 
fitpars1 <- lme(grade ~ method, dd, 
   random = list( schoolid = pdBlocked(list(pdDiag(~1), pdIdent(~ methodn - 1))) ))
fitpars2 <- lme(grade ~ method, dd, 
   random = list( schoolid = pdBlocked(list(pdDiag(~1), pdIdent(~ methodmat - 1))) ))
summary(fitpars1)
#> Linear mixed-effects model fit by REML
#>   Data: dd 
#>        AIC      BIC    logLik
#>   634.3574 654.0566 -311.1787
#>
